input_text:
Job Title: Maintenance Planner

Location: Malvern, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Primary Purpose

Increase Maintenance Productivity through planning, scheduling, and coordination of resources.

Description Of Essential Duties

Be a resource for the Maintenance Supervisors to increase craft productivityBe the site specialist in the SAP system Maintain the work order/ work request system in SAPEnter purchase requisitions in SAP using the Work Order systemCreate and maintain an accurate equipment history in SAP using the Work Order systemImprove area equipment reliability and optimize resources. Develop accurate down day & shutdown schedules for your areaProvide a weekly list of available planned work for each supervisor to schedule Be knowledgeable and manage your Area work order backlogInterface with Area Maintenance Technicians and Operators to get the right down day & daily work scheduledPlan and coordinate projects and process improvements in your AreaCheck the ‘Malvern Action Log’ daily and work with the Maintenance Supervisors to get items in your Area resolvedCreate and maintain the drawings, prints, manuals, etc for the department.Enter appropriate work requests for required follow-up work. Participate in area project work and lead projects when necessary.Attend/Participate in maintenance crew meetings and other group functional meetings/training.Lead for “Job Specific Contact” for contractors (as required). 

Key Safety/housekeeping Reponsibilities

Wear proper PPE at all times as requiredBe lock-out certified for the areaEnsure control room/area remains neat and cleanBe aware of all personnel working in the areaEnsure ARAUCO exercises responsible environmental stewardship in all areas of our business. Complete LASER for any upset condition or procedurePerform housekeeping regularly and during downtimeActively participate and positively contribute to the safety programReport all safety incidents (including near misses)Know location of all fire equipment and how to use it

Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

High school diploma or equivalent requiredAbility to lift up to 50 pounds requiredMinimum 2 years experience working in a manufacturing facility requiredVerifiable computer skills including MS Excel and MS Project requiredMinimum 1 year experience in a role requiring planning and organizational skills preferredExperience working in a Maintenance Management System preferredStrong written and communication skills required (must be verifiable)

Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Improve area equipment reliability and optimize resources

Provide a weekly list of available planned work for each supervisor to schedule
Be knowledgeable and manage your Area work order backlog
Interface with Area Maintenance Technicians and Operators
Get the right down day & daily work scheduled
Plan and coordinate projects and process improvements
Check the ‘Malvern Action Log’ daily
Work with the Maintenance Supervisors to get items in your Area resolved
Create and maintain the drawings, prints, manuals, etc for the department
Enter appropriate work requests for required follow-up work
Participate in area project work and lead projects when necessary
Attend/Participate in maintenance crew meetings and other group functional meetings/training
Lead for “Job Specific Contact” for contractors
Report all safety incidents (including near misses)
